identificationModule.briefTitle: An Open Label, Phase 1b, Ascending Dose Study of DM199
identificationModule.officialTitle: An Open Label, Phase 1b, Single CENTER, Ascending Dose Study TO ASSESS THE SAFETY AND TOLERABILITY of DM199 With a Comparative Pharmacokinetic Study of DM199 Administered Intravenously and a Bioavailability Assessment of Subcutaneous Administration of DM199 in Normal Healthy Subjects

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a Phase 1B study to assess the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of DM199 in healthy volunteers. The study will be consist of two parts: Part A will focus on intravenous dosing and Part B will directly compare intravenous dosing with subcutaneous dosing.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.0
primaryOutcomes.description: Assessment of safety of intravenous dosing

secondaryOutcomes.description: Assess drug associated biomarkers (e.g. plasma bradykinin levels)

seeAlsoLinks.label: Safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetic profile of recombinant human tissue kallikrein, DM199, after intravenous and subcutaneous administration in healthy volunteers
